metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 33 axioms covering execution envisionment, success/failure prediction, threshold effects, context specificity, and temporal aspects
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities, envisioned causal systems, and threshold reasoning

axioms.title: Definition of actionIn
axioms.fol: (forall (e a p) (iff (actionIn e a p) (exists (g e1) (and (agentOf a e)(plan p a g)(subgoalIn' e1 e p) (cause e1 e)))))
axioms.english: An action e by an agent a in a plan p of a's is an eventuality in which a is the agent of the action and that occurs because it is in the plan p. Here e1 is the condition of eventuality e being a subgoal in plan p. It causes e to actually occur.

axioms.title: Definition of sideEffect
axioms.fol: (forall (e a p) (iff (sideEffect e a p) (exists (e1) (and (subgoalIn e1 p)(not (subgoalIn e p)) (causallyInvolved e1 e)))))
axioms.english: A side effect of an execution of a plan is an eventuality that is caused by the achievement of some subgoal in the plan but is itself not a subgoal of the plan.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionExecution
axioms.fol: (forall (a b s p) (iff (envisionExecution a b s p) (exists (g) (and (ecsSeq s a)(plan p b g) (forall (c1 e1) (if (and (inSeq c1 s)(eventualityIn e1 c1)) (or (subgoalIn e1 p)(sideEffect e1 b p)))) (exists (c2 e2) (and (inSeq c2 s)(eventualityIn e2 c2) (actionIn e2 b p)))))))
axioms.english: Agent a envisions a sequence s of executions of some agent b's plan p. This holds when s is a sequence of causal systems that is envisioned by a, when every element of the sequence consists of eventualities that are either subgoals in p or side effects, and when at least one of those eventualities is an action by b.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionSelfExecution
axioms.fol: (forall (a s) (iff (envisionSelfExecution a s p) (envisionExecution a a s p)))
axioms.english: A very important special case of this is when an agent envisions the execution of the agent's own plan.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionExecutionSuccess
axioms.fol: (forall (a b s g) (iff (envisionExecutionSuccess a b s g) (exists (p) (and (envisionExecution a b s p)(plan p b g) (envisionedEv g s a)))))
axioms.english: An agent envisions success in an execution of a plan if the goal of the plan is one of the envisioned eventualities.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionExecutionFailure
axioms.fol: (forall (a b s g) (iff (envisionExecutionFailure a b s g) (exists (p e1) (and (envisionExecution a b s p)(plan p b g) (not' e1 g)(envisionedEv e1 s a)))))
axioms.english: An agent envisions failure in an execution of a plan if the negation of the goal of the plan is one of the envisioned eventualities.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionExecutionSideEffect
axioms.fol: (forall (a b s e p) (iff (envisionExecutionSideEffect a b e s p) (exists (g) (and (envisionExecution a b s p)(plan p b g) (sideEffect e b p)(envisionedEv e s a)))))
axioms.english: Agents can envision the side effects of plans.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionedLikelihoodOfSuccess
axioms.fol: (forall (d a b s g c) (iff (envisionedLikelihoodOfSuccess d a b s g c) (exists (e1) (and (envisionExecutionSuccess a b s g) (likelihood' e1 d g c)(believe a e1)))))
axioms.english: d is the likelihood (a point on the likelihood scale) that agent a envisions the ecs sequence s to contain the successful achievement of goal g by agent b, given constraints c.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionedOpportunity
axioms.fol: (forall (e a b s g) (iff (envisionedOpportunity e a b s g) (exists (p1 g1 p) (and (envisionExecution a b s p1)(plan p1 b g1) (envisionedEv e s a)(not (subgoalIn e p1)) (plan p b g)(subgoalIn e p)))))
axioms.english: An envisioned opportunity is an eventuality that is discovered in the course of envisioning the execution of a plan by an agent, that is not a subgoal in that plan, but that is a subgoal in another plan to achieve some goal of the agent's.

axioms.title: Definition of thresholdOfFailure
axioms.fol: (forall (t s0 a b s) (iff (thresholdOfFailure t s0 a b s) (exists (p g e e1 e2 x x1 x2 z e0) (and (envisionExecution a b s p)(plan p b g) (inSeq x s)(inSeq x1 s)(inSeq x2 s) (resolveBranch x e e1 e2 x1) (resolveBranch x e e2 e1 x2) (lts' e1 z t s0)(geqs' e2 z t s0) (not' e0 g)(eventualityIn e0 x1) (eventualityIn g x2)))))
axioms.english: t is a threshold point on a scale s0 in agent a's envisionment s of b's plan. The envisionment contains a two-way branch point that is resolved in both ways. The disjunction branched on is whether some entity z is less than, or greater than or equal to, the threshold. Failure to achieve goal g is in the less-than branch. Success is in the greater-than-or-equal-to branch.

axioms.title: Definition of specific1
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e) (iff (specific1 x s e) (exists (e1) (and (member x s)(arg* x e1)(causallyInvolved e1 e) (forall (y e2) (if (and (member y s)(nequal y x) (subst x e1 y e2)) (or (not e2) (not (causallyInvolved e2 e)))))))))
axioms.english: Entity x is a specific member of set s with respect to some purpose e. This holds when there is a property e1 of x that is causally involved in e, and when for all other members of the set, the corresponding property either does not hold or is not causally involved in e.

axioms.title: Definition of arbitrary
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e) (iff (arbitrary x s e) (forall (e1 y) (if (and (arg* x e1)(causallyInvolved e1 e) (member y s)) (exists (e2) (and (subst x e1 y e2) (causallyInvolved e2 e)))))))
axioms.english: Entity x is an arbitrary member of set s with respect to purpose e. This holds when for any property e1 that x has that impacts e, any other member y of the set has the corresponding property e2 and it also impacts e.

axioms.title: Definition of arbitraryExecutionContext
axioms.fol: (forall (b e0 a a1 e) (iff (arbitraryExecutionContext b e0 a a1 e) (exists (s p e1 b1 s1) (and (envisionExecution' e0 a a1 s p) (backgroundBeliefs' e1 b1 e0)(dset s1 b1 e1) (arbitrary b s1 e)))))
axioms.english: A set b of background beliefs is an arbitrary execution context for an execution envisionment event e0 by agent a, where the arbitrariness is with respect to purpose e. This holds exactly when e0 is an envisioning by a of a sequence s of executions of some plan p of agent a1's, and furthermore b is an arbitrary member of the set s1 of such sets b1 of background beliefs.

axioms.title: Definition of momentInExecution
axioms.fol: (forall (t0 x) (iff (momentInExecution t0 x) (exists (t s) (and (timeSpanOf t s)(eventualitiesOf s x) (insideTime t0 t)))))
axioms.english: A moment in an envisioned execution is an instant in its time span.

axioms.title: Definition of arbitraryMomentInExecution
axioms.fol: (forall (t0 x e) (iff (arbitraryMomentInExecution t0 x e) (exists (e1 t s) (and (momentInExecution' e1 t x) (arbitrary t0 s e)(dset s t e1)))))
axioms.english: An instant t0 is an arbitrary moment in an envisioned execution x if it is an arbitrary member of the set of such moments, given some purpose e.

axioms.title: Definition of envisionedExecutionDuration
axioms.fol: (forall (d x u a b) (iff (envisionedExecutionDuration d x u a b) (exists (s p) (and (envisionExecution a b s p)(inSeq x s) (durationOf d x u)))))
axioms.english: The envisioned duration of an execution is the duration of an execution that is being envisioned. Agent a envisions a sequence s of contiguous ecs's containing x, and d is the duration of x in units u.

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Moderate use of primed predicates for mental processes: subgoalIn', not', likelihood', lts', geqs', envisionExecution', backgroundBeliefs', momentInExecution'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: No axioms use (etc) condition - all execution envisionment rules are non-defeasible logical definitions
conversion_notes.threshold_reasoning: Complex threshold logic in axiom 33.10 with branch resolution and scale comparisons for success/failure determination
conversion_notes.context_theory: Sophisticated treatment of specific vs. arbitrary execution contexts with purpose-relative definitions
conversion_notes.cross_references: Heavy integration with envisioning theory (Chapter 24), planning (Chapter 31), belief systems (Chapter 21), and temporal reasoning (Chapter 16)
conversion_notes.mental_simulation: Complete framework for imagining plan execution as alternative to costly real-world action
conversion_notes.multi_agent_modeling: Agents can envision both their own plan execution and others' plan execution
conversion_notes.opportunity_detection: Framework for discovering unexpected opportunities during execution envisionment

file_format_notes.logical_structure: Complex nested quantification especially in envisionExecution and thresholdOfFailure definitions
file_format_notes.predicate_consistency: Consistent use of execution envisionment terminology with clear semantic distinctions
file_format_notes.defeasibility_markers: No defeasible rules - all axioms are strict logical definitions
file_format_notes.reification_patterns: Systematic reification of mental processes, likelihood judgments, and temporal relations
file_format_notes.branching_logic: Sophisticated branch resolution logic for modeling threshold effects and alternative outcomes
